name: Live Aqua Cancun All Inclusive

reviews.text: We just returned from our girl's escape to Cancun. Thanks to everyone on TripAdvisor for all the great comments on this Hotel. You reviews helped us pick this hotel and gave us great tips. I've been to Cancun 3 times in the past and each hotel has been nice (all 4* and up) but this is now my favorite! Here are my thoughts. When you walk into the lobby this wonderful spa smell greets you. Instantly you start feeling relaxed. Everything was very clean, fresh, and well maintained. The staff was friendly and helpful. The front desk made sure we got a room we were happy with (we booked an oceanview and they originally offered us a 1st floor room. The front desk lady took us to the room to see it first, but due to the trees you could barely see the ocean. She then found us another room on the 2nd floor which was perfect). Rooms were not large but plenty of space for 3 ladies to share. Beds were very comfortable and had both feather and foam pillows so you could pick your preference. We stopped in the lobby to smell the 5 scent choices and picked our favorite. It was so lovely to be greeted by our chosen scent each time we entered our room. You can hear people who talk loudly in the halls (but in Mexico everything is glass and tile and anything that absorbs sound is going to absorb moisture and go bad faster) but the hotel was not full of crazy party types). We couldn’t hear anything from the rooms around us, just the hall and very infrequently. They have 8 or so pools and most were different temperatures. Unfortunately we had 2 cooler days (not Live Aqua's fault but I know they would have tried to fix the weather if they could have!) and enjoyed the heated Club/Bar Pool and hot tub (not super-hot which is perfect for Mexico). The waiters at the pools were so good - fast and accurate and always smiling. We were a little concerned the first night at the skill of the bartenders due to so-so drinks at the indoor bar on the lower level (bar name escapes me) but the bartenders outside at all the pool bars – swim-up, swing and main pool - were AWESOME!!! Manual, Oct.... , Leonardo, Saul made the best drinks, shots and were so much fun. They came up with fun shots and new drinks based on our likes. The 30+ rainbow shot run that domino'ed into the glasses of Sprite was soooo cool. Now let me tell you about the food. When you go to an all-inclusive the food is often pretty and nicely presented but boring or ehhh.., but not here. Everything from the buffet at breakfast, to the restaurants, to the pool service, to room service was actually really good. We were so happily surprised. No the steaks are not $50 a steak prime, but everything had nice flavors, well cooked - tender when it should be, and well-seasoned. Ask and you shall receive at Live Aqua. Thank you to all the staff - I hope to come back with my husband in the near future (as soon as I can find someone to watch the kids). Also the people who roll all the towels can really roll them tight so don’t get in a rolled towel fight.
reviews.title: Wonderful - best stay I've had in Cancun

reviews.text: We had an excellent time. The staff at Live Aqua was always professional and friendly. Their mission is truly to make your stay an enjoyable one. Being all-inclusive they do it without the expectation of tips and instead are driven by a strong community sense of pride. They took extra steps to make my birthday special including sending a birthday cake to our room, and on a separate occasion decorating our room with balloons and confetti. This was done without request. I can only surmise that one of the front check-in staff noticed my "Dirty 30" birthday shirt. That is a ridiculous level of attention to detail that this place provides. Rooms were spacious, AC was cold, be prepared! Food was top notch, although deserts could be improved. Perhaps they lacked a sweetness our American tongues are accustomed to. Everything was first class. Perhaps the only thing missing was some evening programming to provide diversity to the nights. At other all-inclusives they held events to help couples mingle and interact or offer live entertainment, ie. mariachi and trio bands. Nights basically turn into meeting at the upstairs bar/lounge and DJ on staff did an excellent job of playing a mix of music. Given an option to return, I easily would.
reviews.title: Great way to turn 30.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just arrived home to a blizzard after being at Live Aqua from Mar 1-5th... I already miss it a lot!
reviews.title: Great Vacation at Live Aqua!!

reviews.text: From the wonderful ocean view room on the 2nd floor with an awesome view of the bright blue water..to the exceptional service on the beach especially from Walter and Aminael, the great service from Wilfredo at Azur(who recommended me the chefs special that was not on the menu), and very special shout out to my new friend Gerardo for the awesome setting up of my cabana and beach chairs on the level between the beach and the pools..(who we nicknamed Gerry) he is a really good kid who showed us respect and even volunteered to showed us the places to shop at the Cancun mercados on his own time, the easy check in and friendly convo with Nancy from the lobby..... Back to LA, great service, nice gym,excellent breakfast and also great 24 hour room service(thanks Julio!)... Loved there chilaquiles! There guacamole and chips at the ceviche bar was so yummy!!.. Pools and beaches were top notch and everyone was always so helpful... I only wish I can come back in July but can't since that time I'm bringing my kids so til next year my dear friends.. I really appreciate how the staff goes out of there way to accommodate the guest... This is by far the best all inclusive I have ever been to and plan on returning next year for sure!
reviews.title: professional, clean and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came to relieve some stress and thats exactly what Live Aqua provided... THANK YOU LIVE AQUA!!!! esperamos a regresar el proximo ano mis amigos.. Saludos desde Chicago!
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.text: First time vacation to Cancun with our 7 & 5 y.o. children. The Aqua was beautiful from the entrance to the lobby & the pool grounds were wonderful. Aromatherapy throughout. NO kids club as noted on their website or in their brochures, this was a HUGE disappointment. Also NO kids pool. There is 1 "adults only" designated pool. All the others are open to all. And we agree with the others, their pools are cold - huge disappointment. Beach was fine, but you are taking a risk swimming there. Drops off very quickly. Had trouble with our room the first night - no hot water & the bathroom door handle was falling off. Got moved to a new room the next morning which was great. We felt for the price, the hallways and rooms could have been cleaner and maintained better (dust bunnies everywhere, stains on floors, outlet covers falling off, etc.). Turndown service with aromatherapy is a delight! Also, add the breakfast buffet at Siete (onsite) to your package - amazing food & worth the price!
reviews.title: Relaxing and Wonderful, with room to grow

reviews.text: Feb 21, 2009 - Just what my 2 girlfriends and I needed! - an oasis and alternative to the spring breakers. From the moment we entered and were greeted by a wonderful aroma of jasmine and mint (?) to the person who said we should take a seat and they would come to US for check-in,it just got better. The food - 3 fab restaurants. The service was impeccable. The property well maintained. Great finess room. The cabana rental included twenty minute foot massage! Pricier than what my friends & I are accustomed to but well worth every penny! On the beach Antonio kept us well supplied with drinks. Jesus was great at the breakfast buffet (delicious food). Overall FIVE stars!!!
reviews.title: A beautiful property and fantastic service

reviews.text: First of all, i am not overreacting or i am linked to the hotel in anyway, this hotel its amazing!
reviews.title: Proabably The Best Beach Hotel In The World!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i, stayed for 4 nights for a convention/leisure trip, so be sure i see all the business and leisure activities in the hotel.
reviews.title: 5 star hotel with 5 star service

reviews.text: The Aqua its a must see in every way, first when you arrive to the hotel you find on the door, two white Rolls Royce Silver Shadows for the guests, this might tell you something, the rooms (For me a deluxe suite with balcony and an impressive jacuzzi/bathtub), the pools (4 with different temperatures), the restaurants( luxury its the word), the spa (all kinds of massages including temazcal), and the general areas each one with a particular flavor in the air ej mint.
reviews.title: Royal 5 star treatment FANTASTIC

reviews.text: Stayed at the Aqua Cancun for 4 nights in April 2009. Beautiful hotel. Gorgeous views of the caribbean sea. Wonderful pools. Excellent service. Location was great. Across the street from Plaza La Isla and Plaza Kukuclan 5 minute walk down street from hotel. Breakfast buffet at Siete was wonderful. Would definitely recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: The Aqua Is Beautiful

reviews.text: I have stayed at Hotel Aqua several times in the past, but recently had my destination wedding there with 80 guests in attendance in November, 2008. The location is excellent as it is right across from the main mall La Isla. The service was exceptional, and all of my guests were greeted promptly and were made to feel very welcomed. The hotel is very modern and they have added all the special touches such as aromatherapy in all of the hotel areas. When you check in, you are greeted with a complimentary tea and hand massage. Our rooms were very clean, looked brand-new and we really enjoyed the choice of aromatherapy out of 4 scents. The turn down service was exceptional as well. The concierge floor was closed during our stay but they were able to bring us the room service appetizers each day instead. The pool area is outstanding with many choices and has about 8 different pools. The Azul bar was very nice and the food outside was great! The hotel restaurants served great food as well, both a little pricey and would have liked to have had one choice that was more child and family friendly for a casual dining experience though as both were more upscale. The service for our wedding was great and they did a fantastic job and all of the planning and set-up, food, etc. I can't wait to come back there for my anniversary!!
reviews.title: Best hotel with style in Cancun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a Fiesta Americana hotel the Aqua was quite impressive. From check-in to check-out everyone was extremely hospitable and kind. I even fell sick while staying at the hotel (not food related) and they were kind enough to get me a doctor and at a very reasonable price.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: I can't speak for comparable value since I haven't stayed at any other hotel in Cancun since my last trip there 10 years ago however the rooms, facilities and pool area are gorgeous. Impressive place to take a loved one. Drinks and food were very expensive at the hotel but I wouldn't expect anything different at another hotel. Location is great for everything and there is even a small mall and grocery store right across the street.
reviews.title: GOOD DESTINY FOR ALL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exept from Front desk treatment, they are all so great. Hotel gives you and relax ambience and thecomfort of comtemporary stile. magnificent pool and excelent concierge Department. People at front desk are quite distant if you compare them with the rest of the staff. I don't regret having being sent there due to hotels overcrowd.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel...... Great getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rather than reiterate all the good things that have been said about this resort, I thought I would list some of the things you can do, or make sure to experience while you are vacationing here:
reviews.title: Tips for maximum enjoyment

reviews.text: 1. Restaurants: in order of favourites: MB, Azur, Sea Corner, Seite, InLaKech...did not enjoy Hidden Garden.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.text: 2. Most Mexico all inclusives do not have good beef, not the case here, beef is excellent.
reviews.title: Live Aqua-WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. My wife & I are wine snobs, the house wine is Anterra from Chile, drinkable but not very good. Go across the street(300 yard to the left, La Europa) wine store, excellent selection, reasonable prices, they let you bring your own bottle to every restaurant. Best move we made.
reviews.title: Extraordinary

reviews.text: 4. Best pool is the Pool Club with the swim up bar, Manuel & Everardo are great.
reviews.title: Loved!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at Live Aqua for 4 nights in February and cannot wait to return in August! This is a great place to get away, relax and enjoy the sun and beach. There are simply NO complaints to be listed for me! Just compliments. Be sure to make a reservation for the Hidden Garden Restaurant. It is wonderful. Also..the cooked to order breakfast is a definite to start your day! If you can swing it for a suite do it! The daily foot massage and cabana access was worth it, especially for my husband who loves a great massage. This is the place to go!!
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked very much the layout of this hotel. If you book an Ocean View or higher room, you get great views of the ocean. Also, the first 2 floors are occupied by restaurants and other facilities (spa, gym). We received a room at 4th floor which was more like 6th floor. All rooms have balconies with a table and 2 chairs, so you can enjoy eating, drinking, while watching the ocean.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived there, the lobby seamed to have a heavy feeling, too much spa-like. However, the resort is not like that. It's a combination of relaxation and fun. It also depends on the people that are traveling at the same time with you. There was a group that had fun in the pool until late night. They play spa music in some areas, including one spot of the lap pool, but not everywhere. The bar by the beach plays pop music. There is also a small restaurant besides it, where they serve fish tacos and other small plates, and play Mexican music. It's very pretty because it's right on the beach and you can also enjoy the view.
reviews.title: Total R&R Vacation

reviews.text: They have a list with activities, but didn't pay attention to it, as we wanted to relax; there are also some shows and dinner on the beach on some days. There is a night club, Egos, but not very busy. I think that they can take you to different night clubs in Cancun, a different one each evening. I don't know exactly how it works.
reviews.title: Shop for deals, Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked to have breakfast at the buffet, it had a large variety of options; the lunch at Azur, which again is by the beach and has a beautiful view of the ocean. The MB is select and very nice for dinner. We didn't try the other restaurants. The sushi corner is nice if you want to have something quick and also remember the coffee shop which serves espresso specialties and pastries in the morning and nice cakes after 10 am.
reviews.title: Honeymoon of a lifetime!

reviews.text: A business trip brought me to Aqua in March 2009 and because my company footed the bill, I have no idea what it cost, but I do know I would definitely return. The hotel was immaculately clean. The vibe is very zen-like with tons of aromatherapy scents in the air. The even offer aromatherapy in the room every night free of charge. One night they even brought a rock garden and a water fall which were incredibly helpful with calming my stress levels with my business trip. My room overlooked the center of the main pool, but I think there are at least 7. It looked amazing. The staff was nice, but my one issue was that they were not as prepared for guests as they should have been. I waited over an hour to check into my room, even though the hotel was only at 30% capacity, mainly because the hotel was understaffed (because tourism was down due to Mexico-border violence) . Which was the other down-side. The hotel had a really cool lounge, but there were so few people staying at the hotel that it was near-empty every night. In any case, I've been to Cancun 3 times - twice for personal trips - and this is the best hotel I've stayed at. I would definitely go back and would highly recommend it. (Almost forgot to mention - the spa is AMAZING!!)
reviews.title: Incredibly Zen-like and peaceful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally booked an oceanfront room with balcony. Once the flu scare kicked in, we watched for the US travel advisory status as our trip got closer. A week out, the advisory was lifted (we were going regardless). At the same time I checked the rates and they were lower for an ocean front room with a terrace and breakfast included. So I canceled, and rebooked. Great deal.
reviews.title: Great Long Week-End

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only other trip to Cancun was last year when we stayed at Le Blanc. So our comparison was constantly referring back to Le Blanc. Of course, that's not fair, so we tried to keep an open mind on Aqua.
reviews.title: A great deal if you can get it

reviews.text: Just like last year, I used Brant at Entertainment Plus for transport from the airport. Great people! Check In was flawless. We were led to our room where we unpacked and then headed to get some lunch. We ate at the hotel's Azur which was pretty good, but over priced for lunch.
reviews.title: OUR 3 NIGHT STAY FELT LIKE A WEEK, WONDERFUL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is really nice with tile everywhere. The pool areas are great. Actually, I'd rate their pool areas as nice as Le Blanc I think.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Attentive and Gracious Staff, Great Food

reviews.text: The staff is unbelievable friendly and accommodating. The food is amazingly good, breakfast , tacos by the pool. You name it.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with Incredibly service !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOVE THIS HOTEL!!
reviews.title: Friendly Staff with Top-Notch Service
Winter escape
reviews.text: Can't wait to go back in May to that infinite pool!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, can't be better If you like to shop across the street is the La Isla shopping center.
reviews.title: Was exactly what we needed

reviews.text: My wife and I recently visited Live Aqua the week of February 25, 2013. We chose Live Aqua based off on the price and rating. Needless to say, we were very please with our choice!
reviews.title: Overall, wonderful experience!

reviews.text: My 20-year old niece wanted to go somewhere warm for Spring Break with three of her college roommates so my partner and I offered to chaperone them to Mexico. This was my 8th trip to Cancun. As far as luxury hotels there, I’ve stayed at Le Meridien twice and JW Marriott twice. They’re both highly recommended but I’ve always wanted to try Aqua Cancun.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Will Definitely Return!

reviews.text: On a side note…please don’t worry about travelling there. It’s sad to see so many stories online about tourists who are terrified to go to Mexico right now. I’ve always felt very safe…more so than some U.S. cities I’ve been to…and this time was no different. Just stick to the tourist areas and you’ll be fine. Besides, the rates for all of the hotels down there are deeply discounted now (like 35% off or better). The exchange rate is phenomenal, too ($1USD = 14 pesos). It’s just too good to pass up.
reviews.title: Overrated!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for 4 days (March 14 – 18). We booked 2 Deluxe Ocean View rooms for the four girls and an Ocean Front with Terrace for us. Most of the rates for the 5-star resorts in Cancun were in the low-$200…quite a bargain. The Ocean View rooms were booked on Expedia and each included a $200 resort credit. The Ocean Front room was booked on Orbitz and included free daily breakfast for two. I originally tried to book all of the rooms through one website but I found it interesting that they offered different packages. BTW, the breakfast buffet at Siete is incredible. You should definitely try to book a package that includes it. The food is wonderful with an extensive selection. It normally costs 260 pesos ($18 USD). Well worth it.
reviews.title: Blissful

reviews.text: The entry, lobby and grounds are quite impressive. It has a very clean, modern feel. Check-in was a breeze. When you arrive, they take your luggage and seat you in a lounge area while one of the front desk people helps with your reservation. They offered us an upgrade to a corner “Aqua Suite” (Room #4003) for an additional $200/night but we talked them down to $150. It was pretty spectacular with a huge balcony looking out at the water. Check out the photos we’ve posted. The suite included a daily cabana out by the pool, which included water, fruit and a free foot massage. I probably wouldn’t pay for the cabana out of pocket but it’s a nice add-on if it comes with your package. However, I’m sure I would try to book one of those suites in advance next time, particularly since they seem to be discounted regularly. Or, you can always book a standard room and see what kind of deal you can negotiate when you get there.
reviews.title: Aqua Cancun is Noisey Cancun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge, Omero, was amazing. He showed us the rooms and even helped the girls out when they wanted to switch rooms to be closer to each other and on the same floor. He greeted us every time we were in the lobby, asked how we were doing, and assisted us with dinner reservations and transportation to the market and airport. Super nice guy.
reviews.title: Amazing...a perfect getaway

aka: Live Aqua Cancun All Inclusive Hotel Cancun
description: Live Aqua Cancun, a welcoming place, where being is the first part of feeling. Your senses work together. It's a prism of colors, eclectic rhythms, and seductive details. Enjoy the fusion of idyllic days and energizing nights. It is a monument to your arrival to this Cancun Spa Resort. This sophisticated beachfront resort lies along white sand beaches, across the street from La Isla Shopping Mall and walking distance from some of the best restaurants and shopping malls in the city. Exotic drinks, barefoot luxury and activities overlooking the resort's 8 infiniti pools are just part of the exquisite details within our All Inclusive concept. Music worships you at every step, with changes in rhythms that match the emotions you feel and the space around you. The sound is never the same, but always relaxing, exciting and harmonic. Arriving, leaving, just belonging makes you sigh with peace. The Aqua aroma seeps into every nook and cranny up to the sky, down to the sea. Return to yourself.
